item.title: \[ICCV 21'\] Calibrating Concepts and Operations- Towards Symbolic Reasoning on Real Images
item.description: Overview Figure 1: Statistics and examples from the synthetic CLEVR dataset and the real GQA dataset. Compared to the synthetic dataset, VQA on real data needs to deal with long-tail concept distribution and uneven importance of reasoning steps. Figure 2: A failure case that can be corrected by reweighting the operations. The select(bag) operation overrides filter(not black), thus lead to incorrect answer. This can be corrected by scaling up the result of filter operation.
